text.p: Spyglass Inc on Tuesday said it expected to report a loss of $0.26 to $0.28 a share for the third quarter ending June 30, more than twice as large as Wall Street had estimated.
Analysts on average were expecting the Internet device software and services company to post a loss of $0.12 a share, according to a First Call survey.
Spyglass said it expected revenues of between $2 million and 2.3 million for the quarter.
In last year's third quarter, Spyglass earned $0.07 a share on revenues of $6.0 million.

Spyglass Chief Executive Doug Colbeth said in a news release that the market for Internet-enabled devices was in an early stage of development. Revenues were limited to initial development and professional services fees.

Colbeth said recent "design wins" with several market leading companies meant "great potential for significant revenue from future royalties as our customers ship products incorporating Spyglass technology."
Spyglass shares were unchanged at nine on Tuesday.
